TopicTitle: Whats the hardest thing to do in KSP?

Articles.Content: What is the hardest thing to do for you? Orbital rendezvous? Planetary intercepts? Killing Kerbals? (Don't be Nexter or Danny2462, please). What is the hardest for you?
Time warping. I can't warp through interplanetary transfers without doing other stuff closer by in the meanwhile.
Concentrate on one project- 5 going on right now

An grand tour to every planet that uses no dropships and has only one stage(and probably a lot of drills).

That's the hardest thing ever.

shunting a heavy train.. around KSC.. with building destruction enabled and actually have some of KSC left around the yard by the time the trains ready

runaway wagons become slow speed terminal missiles for just about every important building around the carpark.. the sheer mass of a 4 wagon train running at 5m/s with no brakes (thanks squad...) a little tap and its all over
Urgh. Rovers. I give up. Can't get them onto a ship and keep the ship balanced. Can't get them onto the planet off the ship. Can't stop them leaving the ground. I want a river hangar piece!
Keeping track of everything and everyone without using mods.... (no alarm clock). I'm constantly writing down notes

Urgh. Rovers. I give up. Can't get them onto a ship and keep the ship balanced. Can't get them onto the planet off the ship. Can't stop them leaving the ground. I want a river hangar piece!

You can transfer Hangar(SPH) designs to the VAB, btw: When you load something in the VAB, there are 2 buttons on top of the items... So you can first design your rover in the SPH and then build the rocket under it in the VAB.
Landing On every anomaly in the kerbol system and every planet. Each landing has to be from the edge of the SOI and with a single craft with no mining.And you have to land on jool and kerbol.

Stop playing.

Happy landings!

Turning it off and going to bed

Not max out my active contracts. Even when I'm specifically trying to wait for ones to go to a specific place, suddenly I'll be loaded up on a base, flag, survey, satellite, 8-tourists and an interplanetary toaster...

Turning it off and going to bed

This.
Paying attention to the family.
Stopping playing it.
Getting a water tank to my aeroponics module

The hardest thing to do in KSP is to stop the addiction. Looking up transfer windows and dV calculations at work is kind of over the top, don't you think? Still, it keeps the mind alive and healthy where real life simply kills brain cells so I am not complaining

Outside the game gameplay? Completing stuff. So many of my projects died a quiet death after I saw something shiny and forgot about them.

in gameplay: Eve orbit from sea level. This was back in like 0.22-0.23 when neither ISRU nor XL parts (and more notable, XL size engines) were a thing. Good god I spent so much hours on that project before I finally got it to work.
EVE SSTO without mods or glitch abuse.
Its Gilly. Encountering it, orbiting it, deorbiting, landing, and stabilising on it is a total PITA. Without KAS harpoons, I miss every surface.
Stopping myself putting in more mods.

Probably returning from the surface of Jool (When the altimeter hits zero). Yes someone has done that. Oh and with stock parts.
